intro: Hedyosmum scaberrimum, commonly known as the rough hedyosmum, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds. Hedyosmum scaberrimum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
